item.title: Python: unsupervised learning: non-hierarchical clustering
item.description: # Clustering techniques Hierarchical clustering Hierarchical clustering is to find the most similar combination in the data It is a method of making clusters in order, and is characterized by having a hierarchical structure during the process. See the figure below for a concrete example. There are 5 data points A,B,C,D,E. The closest of these 5 data We will make one cluster. A, B, C, D, E â†’ (A,B), C,D,E In this case, the two points A and B are the closest points in this combination.
